page.title: 12THE ISLE CONT'D.
page.content: Most of the dwelling places still visible date back no further than the 19th Century.They are built of red brick with several houses being decorated with yellow or black brick. Most of the houses appear to have been farm labourers cottages & are semi- detached.Some are the farmers'houses. The biggest house looks Georgian & has a walled garden and tennis court.Next tothis is a much older black and white timbered house.The buildings around it vary-some are old barns & stables,one withthe date 1874 in coloured tiles on the roof;some others are clearly modern,such as the Dutch Barn. One pair of cottages near Park Lane has the date 1928.
